definition: lit. never taking a short-cut (idiom); fig. upright and honest

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column
(negative prefix)/not/no
to follow/from/it is for...to/reason/cause/because of/due to/to/to leave it (to sb)/by (introduces passive verb)
footpath/track/diameter/straight/directly
not to reject a word because of the speaker (idiom, from Analects); to judge on the merits of the case rather than preference between advisers
good people are at peace with themselves, (but) there is no rest for the wicked
pinyin: jun1 zi5 tan3 dang4 dang4 , xiao3 ren2 chang2 qi1 qi1
related.word: 君子坦荡荡，小人长戚戚

definition: lit. to go straight (idiom, from Analects); to act with integrity
progress seems like regress (the Book of Dao 道德經|道德经[Dao4 de2 jing1], Chpt. 41)
Knowledge is not innate to man, how can we overcome doubt?/We are not born with knowledge, how does one achieve maturity? (i.e. without guidance from a teacher - Tang dynasty essayist Han Yu 韓愈|韩愈)
pinyin: ren2 fei1 sheng1 er2 zhi1 zhi1 zhe3 , shu2 neng2 wu2 huo4
related.word: 人非生而知之者，孰能无惑

definition: nobleman/person of noble character
so dedicated as to forget one's meals (idiom)
upright and plainspoken (idiom)
not a slave to the bottle/able to enjoy alcohol in moderation/able to hold one's drink
depraved life/evil ways/fornication
covertly/secretly
national danger, but no support (idiom, from Analects); the future of the nation is at stake but no-one comes to the rescue
to rub one's head and heels (idiom); to slave for the benefit of others/to wear oneself out for the general good
Confucius says:
Xun Zi or Hsun Tzu (c. 310-237 BC), Confucian philosopher and author of On learning 勸學|劝学
study tirelessly (idiom, from Analects)
